intro: Anchusa calcarea var. scaberrima, commonly known as the rough anchusa, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as cliffs, slopes, and wastelands. Its rough texture and unique floral display make it a distinctive species in its native range.
